meta.description:
A product can be processed on any one of the four devices A, B, C, or D. The setup completion cost for each device when it is activated, the unit cost of production for the product, and the maximum processing capacity for each device are known as shown in Table 5-7. How can the total cost be minimized to produce 2000 units of the product? Try to establish a mathematical model.
Table 5-7
\begin{tabular}{c|c|c|c}
\hline Device & Setup Completion Cost (in yuan) & Production Cost (in yuan per unit) & Maximum Processing Capacity (units) \\\hline A & 1000 & 20 & 900 \
B & 920 & 24 & 1000 \
C & 800 & 16 & 1200 \
D & 700 & 28 & 1600 \
\hline
\end{tabular}

sets.name: Devices
sets.description: Set of devices available for production

params.name: setup_cost
params.description: Setup completion cost for each device

params.name: production_cost
params.description: Production cost per unit for each device

params.name: max_capacity
params.description: Maximum processing capacity for each device

vars.name: x
vars.description: Number of units produced by each device

vars.name: y
vars.description: Binary variable indicating if a device is used

objective.name: total_cost
objective.expr: quicksum(setup_cost[d] * y[d] + production_cost[d] * x[d] for d in Devices)
objective.description: Minimize total setup and production cost

constraints.name: demand
constraints.description: Total production must meet demand of 2000 units

constraints.name: capacity_A
constraints.description: Production on device A cannot exceed its capacity if used

constraints.name: capacity_B
constraints.description: Production on device B cannot exceed its capacity if used

constraints.name: capacity_C
constraints.description: Production on device C cannot exceed its capacity if used

constraints.name: capacity_D
constraints.description: Production on device D cannot exceed its capacity if used
